definition: to replace sb (personnel, sports team player etc)/substitution
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)

sentences.english: Somehow, I just don''t like to change horses in the middle of the stream.
sentences.chinese: 不知什么缘故，我就是不喜欢中途换人。

sentences.english: Because I don't want to have to fill this position again in six months.
sentences.chinese: 因为我不想在六个月内另换人手。

sentences.english: Can one be replaced before the case is ultimately decided?
sentences.chinese: 在最后判决之前，这些法官是否有可能换人？

sentences.english: Play an entire game using manual substitutions, in a non-simulated game.
sentences.chinese: 在一场非模拟比赛，以手动换人完成一场比赛。

sentences.english: Don't replace scaffolder during dismantle the scaffolding without justly reason.
sentences.chinese: 没有充分的理由，脚手架拆除过程中不可换人。

sentences.english: The third and final change was that of Tosto for Raggi.
sentences.chinese: 第三次也是最后一次换人是由特斯托换下了拉吉。

definition: on stage/to go on stage/to take the field
to remain in office/to hold on to one's job
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
(idiom) to take on a leadership role at a time of crisis
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
to leave (the stage, an exam room, the playing field etc)/to take part in some activity/to take an examination (in the imperial examination system)
to move an army and send a general (idiom); to deploy an army/to send a team on a task
